  <p style="margin-top:2rem; max-width:64ch; font-size:1.02rem;">
    This course studies modern methods for sampling from complex, multi-modal distributions
    at scale. Topics include parallel tempering, annealed importance sampling, non-reversible
    MCMC, sequential Monte Carlo, and their connections to generative modelling. Emphasis is
    placed on both theoretical foundations and practical implementations in Julia.
  </p>

  <a href="#" style="display:inline-flex;align-items:center;gap:0.5rem;margin-top:1.4rem;font-family:'DM Mono',monospace;font-size:0.7rem;letter-spacing:0.05em;color:var(--accent);border:1px solid var(--accent);padding:0.45rem 0.9rem;text-decoration:none;">
